greetings: anyone had any success creating a live ubuntu usb stick that works with a Mac laptop?

Does your MAC know how to boot a USB stick?
Try powering off your MAC, stick in the USB stick, then cold power on the MAC and go to the boot menu.
You still cannot see the USB stick in the boot menu?
is this an Intel MAC or Power MAC?
you may want to check the BIOS to see if USB boot is enabled.
is there any way to get to the BIOS, e.g. Press ESC or F10 or some other key on boot up?
so if you wanted to change the boot order (e.g. HD, THEN CDROM), how would you do it?
from my experience with intel (PC) boxes, the BIOS allows certain controls like enable/disable USB boot, change boot order, etc.  I would hope the same is available for an Intel MAC.
do you see the option to boot USB device in the BOOT menu?
so how could you boot a MAC stick?
the boot loader has an option to pick the USB to boot from?
the "Startup Manager" on your MAC does not show the USB drive as a possible boot device?
what kind of MAC (model) do you have>?
